page.title: 08BOATLIFTS DOWNDERRY
page.content: HAULING BOATS FROM THE SEA TO SAFETY ABOVE THE TIDE HAS ALWAYS BEEN DIFFICULT.FORMERLY THE BOATS WERE MANHANDLED ON WOODEN ROLLERS ,WINCH ASSISTED.THE HEAVY BOATS WERE FLOATED ONTO A TRAILER.DOWNDERRY NOW HAS A UNIQUE FORM OF BOATLIFT WHEREBY THE CRAFT IS UNDERSLUNG BENEATH A HORIZONTAL GIRDER WHICH IS ITSELF ON WHEELS.THERE ARE MANY DIFFERENT DESIGNS TO BE SEEN.SOME RAISE THE BOAT BY ROPE AND PULLEY,OTHERS USE THE GIRDER AS A LEVER.THE ORIGINAL{1956 DESIGN USED THE CROWN WHEEL AND PINION OF A VAN TO PROVIDE THE THE MECHANICAL ADVANTAGE.THE INVENTORS,MR. W HOCKING (DOWNDERRY BILL)& MR. A.PALMER WERE PLEASED TO SEE THEIR IDEA PRESENTED IN SO MANY FORMS;THE MOST RECENT ALSO HAS A PETROL ENGINE WHICH HAULS BOAT AND RACK UP A FIXED LINE. WINCHES,TRACTORS LANDROVERS AND PEOPLE ALSO PULL BOATS.
